intro: Reichardia picroides var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite flower heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks. Reichardia picroides var. integrifolia is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
